newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary's MOL slides, bottoms at HUF 3,00.
newsitem.headline: Hungary's MOL slides, bottoms at HUF 3,00.

text.p: Shares in oil and gas company MOL Rt continued to slide on Monday amid selling by investors who hope to buy the stocks back at a lower price during MOL's privatisation, traders said.
MOL opened at 3,240 forints, below Friday's closing price of 3,300. At 1126 GMT MOL traded at 3,010 forints.
"Investors are selling the paper because they think the subscription price will be below current levels in the privatisation," one trader said.
Almost all the selling came from one major securities house and resulted in a fall of over seven percent, traders said.
They added that demand was quite strong at around 3,000 forints and thus doubted the paper would fall below that level on Monday.
Hungary's privatisation agency APV Rt, which still has a 58 percent stake in MOL, plans the second phase of the company's privatisation in the first quarter of the year.
The privatisation law stipulates that APV has to retain a 25 percent plus one share stake in the company.
